WPC (WIRELESS PLANNING & COORDINATION)

MODULE: EXAMINATION AND REPORTS

Synopsis:	
	










	The WIRELESS PLANNING & COORDINATION (WPC) Wing of the Ministry of Communications, created in 1952, is the National Radio Regulatory Authority responsible for Frequency Spectrum Management, including licensing and caters for the needs of all wireless users (Government and Private) in the country. It exercises the statutory functions of the Central Government and issues licenses to establish, maintain and operate wireless stations. WPC is divided into major sections like Licensing and Regulation (LR), New Technology Group (NTG) and Standing Advisory Committee on Radio Frequency Allocation (SACFA). SACFA makes the recommendations on major frequency allocation issues, formulation of the frequency allocation plan, making recommendations on the various issues related to International Telecom Union (ITU), to sort out problems referred to the committee by various wireless users, Siting clearance of all wireless installations in the country etc.

CAREER OBJECTIVE

To succeed in an environment of growth and excellence and earn a job which provides job satisfaction and self-development and help me achieve personal as well as organizational goals.
EXPERIENCE

I am currently working as a Senior Software Engineer in Reporting Services and Data Analytics Team. I have been associated with the software industry for around 7 years of experience in Information technology.

· As a part of assignments, I have been in requirement analysis, Business Intelligence, Application development and maintenance.
· Sound experience in Microsoft SQL Server 2008, Microsoft Business Intelligence tool, like (SSRS, SSIS).
· T-SQL, Stored procedures, Functions, Query optimization.
· Exposure to work in the Client/Server Architecture.
· Experience in developing Custom Reports (Tabular, Matrix, Drill Down, Drill Through)
· ETL Process, Troubleshooting SSIS packages, developing reports using SSRS, report deployment, report subscription.
· Strong analytical skills with the ability to formulate and communicate recommendations for improvement.
· Excellent verbal and written communication and organization skills, attention to details and multi – abilities.
· Experienced in working with SQL Query Analyzer, SQL Server Management Studio, Business Intelligence Development Studio, Scheduling Jobs with SQL Server Agent. 

ACADEMIC QUALIFICATION

GNIIT (Software Engineering) from NIIT LTD.
B.Sc.(IT)  from Kuvempu University, Year of Passing: 2011
MCA from Sikkim Manipal University, Year of passing: 2013
TECHNICAL SKILLS

Technology       			: Business Intelligence.
Domain				: Media and Publishing, HealthCare
Tools			: SSIS, SSRS,
Reporting Tools			: SQL Server Reporting Services, MS Excel
Languages               		: TSQL
Scheduler			: SQL server agent

Database 			: SQL Server
PROJECT:

Project Name: Hungary –Maintenance					Period: Nov 2012 – Apr 2014
Client: Reader’s Digest (Hungary)
Role: Application Maintenance & Enhancement
RDA-Hungary project is a global multi brand media and publishing company that educates, entertains and connects audiences around the world. Reader's digest is dedicated to providing its customers with inspiration, ideas and tools that simplify and enrich their lives in ways that no one else can. The company has a diverse set of business in 45 countries around the world with offices in 66 locations.
Reader's Digest has three main services for their business units:
1. Application maintenance and enhancement 
2. Delivery services.
The application maintenance and enhancement part were concerned with the following:

a) Packages: Several packages were made which were responsible for consuming data from multiple sources simultaneously, performing multiple transformations using SSIS packages.
b) Reports: Generated On-demand for Business Analysis or Management decisions using MS SQL Server Reporting Services 2005 (SSRS).
c) Remedy: For every customer request an incident is created which has to be resolved within the SLA period as per the severity of the ticket.
Responsibilities:

·    Debugging stored procedures, views and tables in SQL Server 2005
· Writing complex queries based on ad-hoc requests
· Debugging stored procedures for SQL server 2005
· Incident management within SLA
· Resolving issues reported by QA Team
· Involved in weekly meetings for technical discussions
· Developed reports
PROJECT	

Project Name: Lash Group – Development                                                                                Period: May 2014 – Till now
Client: Lash Group (North Carolina)
Role: Developer
From high touch to highly automated, Lash Group strategically designs, delivers and continuously improves patient access and adherence programs to ensure patients receive the best possible care, while strengthening product performance at every stage of its life cycle.
